page.title: 18COCKFIELD HALL
page.content: Originally two cottages- the owners think the name came from the corncockle plant which grew in the corn fields years ago. Used to be Cocklefield Hall. The farmhouse was destroyed by fire in the 1920's; the farmer put brushwood round the house and set alight to it. The house was then renovated and rebuilt. Owned by a Mrs Patten in 1930's & she had students living there in specially built quarters. The building was always connected with farming & now has 150 acres including Wells Farm land. Mixed farm originally with a few animals, present owners not farmers. 980's- Fields now bigger some hedges have gone and new buildings constructed.
